Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: mtnairchef
Reviews.Content: I stayed here compliments of a priceline deal and was very surprised and pleased with the service, room and location. My girlfriend felt special that it was her first time in a suite. Room was very clean and staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk First Rate, Very clean/quiet”
Reviews.Author: Dawn B
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this facility. I love the convenience, staff, and cleanliness of the Candlewood Suites. The rates are phenomenal. I frequent the Phoenix area 3-4 times a year and, on occaison, travel w/my dog. This will be my stay of choice for all future visits to the Phoenix area. The on-site facilities are incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a long-term stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Candlewood Suites Phoenix for a total of 67 nights in early 2012 in a comfortable and spacious 1-bedroom suite. The property has lots of extras to make your stay great, from the no-cost laundry and business center, to the swimming pool and spa and BBQ area, to the small gym and on-site shopette. The rooms are spotless, well-designed, and comfy, and the staff genuinely does everything they can to assist their guests. Candlewood felt like home my entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: This extended stay hotel provides exactly what it advertises, a convenient and comfortable place to stay. The whole hotel has just been renovated. The kitchen is new and fully stocked with utinsels for two. The bathroom has been revamped and is spacious for an extended stay. The mattress is new and was reasonably comfortable. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. As always with Candlewood the cupboard provided a clean place to pick up snacks and sundries we had forgotten as well as to do laundry. We found the interior corridors tp be a security bonus. An additional bonus is a great seafood restaurant within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Every basic need for decent price.”
Reviews.Author: Corvette87
Reviews.Content: We paid top $ 150 night for four nights but it was high season. Able to enjoy smoking suite with really nice space. Full kitchen with all the basics. Seperate bedroom so I can sleep In!! Small living room that enabled us to have two friends to visit. Modern size bath with my favorite- shelves to put all our bath stuff. Checked in on Sunday and clerk was one of the best I have ever dealt with. Helped us to find several places we wanted to go. There is adequate gym and decent pool .I even enjoyed seeing others dogs as I was missing mine. My only complaint we had to leave and go other place our last night in town as they were booked!

Reviews.Title: “One night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only needed to stay in Phx for one night, but the room and hotel were so nice I wish we could have stayed longer! They are just completing a huge remodel, and we were the first to stay in our room. We were very impressed with the kitchen area and bathroom, and the bed was very comfy. Loved the "hotel cupboard" which had meals as well as snacks that you purchased on the honor system, and we notied that the new large laundry was free. Everyone was very friendly and helpful! Would definitely recommend to anyone for any stay length/need.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. Business suites”
Reviews.Author: Jster
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for two days at Candlewood Suites for a business trip. The room was about what you expect. The only real complaints were that the AC unit exuded a cigarette smell (easily cured with a Lysol spray) and some of the television channels were pretty fuzzy. My partner said his TV only received a few channels clearly, but he didn't really watch much. The bathroom floor could use a cleaning with bleach. The hotel as a whole is clean, has an honor-system "Cupboard" with snacks, frozen dinners, and drinks that is combined with a free laundry (accesible with the room card), a pool and hot tub, and an exercise room. The location is a bit of a problem as it is on the I17 frontage road. This means that north is the only direction you can go when leaving. To go south, you have to go north and back to the southbound side. The "Enter" sign is small and is obscured by landscaping shrubs until you are just at it. However, the hotel has access to the biking trail of a city park, which means that taking a walk for exercise or fresh air is just a matter of walking through the pool area and out a gate. Aside from traffic noise from the Interstate, it was pretty quiet. There are signs up all over announcing a renovation project scheduled to start in December 2011. The kitchenette was clean and had just about everything you might need in this sort of room. Comparing Candlewood to the business suites just south of it, Candlewood is the much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “My home for 3 months...”
Reviews.Author: leisa40
Reviews.Content: I called ahead approx. 2-3 weeks and booked the room. The staff member that I spoke with was friendly, informative and accomodating. I arrived here in Phoenix the middle of August. The check-in was seamless and the woman at the front desk very pleasant. She called after about an hour to see if I had everything I needed or if she could be of assistance. Good business! Not sure how old this hotel is, but the owner's have done a nice job in keeping it fairly well updated and very clean. I recently heard that they are going to go through and do an upgrade! I had one issue with noise, but it's due to circumstances they can't control. The location of my original room is right between the stairs and the elevator. I didn't hear too much noise from the elevator, but every time someone went up/down the stairs (and it was often!) it sounded like a herd of elephants coming through my bedroom wall and ceiling! I am a night worker/day sleeper and you can imagine how little sleep I was getting...even with earplugs shoved into my ears! I liked my room and didn't really want to move so I tried sleeping in my living room on the sofa. No go. It was still way too noisy! The desk staff were VERY accomodating and moved me to a different room. I was able to stay on the first floor (my preference) and keep my poolside view! Very nice. They gave me ample time to move and didn't rush me. I'm extremely satisfied with my new room AND the manner in which it was handled! Maintenance is very knowledgeable and quick to respond, housekeeping is excellent as well. Can't say enough good about the front desk staff, too. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone I know and will stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyColonel
Reviews.Content: Handy to I17 and good check-in. Fully equipped kitchen and lots of channels on the TV. However . . . I found the bathtub tiny (could have easily been a little wider and longer . . . lots of space). Also, the bath towels were like burlap!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice!”
Reviews.Author: oldsville
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable clean rooms at a very reasonable price. Have had some not so nice stays near downtown Phoenix but this was quite the opposite. Self contained and convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Treborwf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Superbowl Sunday but due to jet lag fell asleep sometime during the second half (this would have been the first time I've ever watched the Superbowl live). They have an honour system to purchase goods from their little convenience shop which my wife thought was great. Was trying to have a shower in the morning but unfortunately the little pin you pull up to switch from bath to shower came away in my hand. Flight to Vegas looming so no time to have the problem fixed, but I can tell you that having a shower in a few inches of bath water is no mean feat. Obviously mentioned the shower problem on check out & was genuinely not expecting anything in return (probably due to the fact that I was excited about going to Vegas) but was pleasantly surprised when I was offered another room to shower in and a refund of my priority points used to purchase the room – that what I call good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Three word review: "Try somewhere else."”
Reviews.Author: DadInASuitcase
Reviews.Content: Maybe we're not the target for this place (family w/ two young kids.) As a suite style hotel, I understand the "self serve" mind set. And if you don't mind being kept up after midnight by a party in the courtyard, then this place might be for you. But I was shocked by the indifference from the staff and management at this hotel when confronted with problems. Specifically, the lack of effort to look for my children's coats that we had left in the closet of the room after checking out. On the (rare) occasion I've left something in other hotels, the staff and management are more than willing to try to find the items and return them to me. Not so here. "It is probably best to let the insurance investigator handle your issue," is the reply I recieved. Hugely disappointing! The upside is that the suite we stayed in was large, well furnished and inexpensive; though it looked as if it had seen better days. The wi-fi access was free, thought intermittent (the ethernet interned worked fine.) And the location is good. But the fact is, there are plenty of other hotels alongs this stretch. I'd recommend spending a little more and trying one of them before going to this place.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: BuddAZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and dog stayed here 4/12/10 ... we had never stayed here before and had a wonderful time - we had booked a non-smoking queen bed, with a sofabed, 2 rm suite, which includes a FULL kitchen. All was perfect, especially the friendly staff, who knew our dogs name our entire stay ! Didn't have the opportunity to use the pool area, but it was large and clean looking - one bonus for us was the property is located right next to a park area which was great for dog walking. Altho it is located right on I-17, we were never bothered by any traffic noises. Give it a try !

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix as stopping point between Grand Canyon and LA”
Reviews.Author: Craxiter
Reviews.Content: Booked mainly on the basis of a very good Entertainment Card rate and my general loyalty to IC Hotels. I think this is the first time I have stayed in a Candlewood, their "business travel medium stay" category. Seems well set up for the business traveler. Lots of services. Nice pool and hot tub in this one. We seem to be getting a bit of I-17 noise and not sure how that will affect sleep. But being near I-17 is part of the advantage of this hotel so all part of the mix.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: JoeTrainer
Reviews.Content: The kids had fun, the front desk clerk was great and went out of her way to make our stay the best it could be!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, no frills”
Reviews.Author: Mooma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Candlewood Suites after a long travel day and having our luggage temporarily lost. We had a rather hard time finding the access road, which is directly next to the I-17 freeway and which you can't really see from the exit (go straight through the lights from the exit ramp and stay right...it looks like you're going back on the freeway but there's actually a road there). We got there and the front desk staffer was very friendly. Our room was basic but the kitchenette had a lot of amenities: microwave, cooktop, dishwasher, lots of cupboard space, larger than usual fridge. The hotel is right next to the freeway and our room was close to the end of the building nearest the freeway, but noise was not an issue. We were basically looking for a clean, safe place to lie down for the night before heading to the Grand Canyon and the Candlewood Suites filled the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewForU
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at a Candlewood Suites and it is pretty much Holiday Inn's answer to Marriott's Towne Place. If you like one, you'll probably like the other. As noted, there's no daily maid service (gee, just like home), but there were more than enough towels for three nights. And you can swap them out at the desk if you need replacements. I was upgraded (Priority Club) to a suite with a bedroom which was nice. The suite is large enough, with TVs in both rooms and a DVD/VCR combo in the living room. I borrowed a free movie from the front desk. Bed was comfy. The room also has a full-size refrigerator/freezer, very handy. Unlike Marriott, they don't offer free breakfast here, but you have a coffee maker, microwave and range top, along with a full set of dishes/silverware and a dishwasher. Check-in and out was easy. Everyone was friendly, and they graciously let me stay a bit later so that my computer wouldn't melt in the car (the Internet, by the way, is wired and very good). The location is on the side of I-17, but it was quiet. Didn't use the pool, but it looked clean. Free washing machines were handy, with mini detergent boxes available for purchase. I left before the Wed. night pizza party, but it sounded nice. One thing -- they have one of those sensors that knows when you leave and hikes the room temperature to 77. Yes, it's the wave of the future, and yes, they have to save electricity. But when it's 112 outside, it takes longer than the promised 15 minutes to returned to the desired 70. Still, overall, this is a very good choice and I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good business stay”
Reviews.Author: Zaphod
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for a four night business stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. I was upgraded to a one-bedroom suite without asking. Housekeeping is not offered on a daily basis, but for a short stay, who really needs it? The room was stocked with plenty of towels, and more were available at the front desk, if needed. The kitchen was handy, especially the full size refrigerator. The selection in "The Cupboard" was suprisingly good. The bed and all of the other furniture were comfortable and in great condition. There is a movie lending library at the front desk. Pappadeaux Seafood Restaurant, two doors down, is fantastic, but is the only restaurant within easy walking distance. There are many dining options at the Metro Center Mall. The complimentary Wednesday night barbeque at the hotel was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Candlewood Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after we landed in Phoenix from New Jersey. Quick check in after a late flight was a pleasant surprise. Quick access out of phoenix the next morning to begin our roadtrip to grand canyon. Would recommend as a hotel at a good price as a stop over to other areas of Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “OK despite the rude man at check in”
Reviews.Author: DJS_2000
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice, no frills. They have a weekly cookout by the pool which is very nice. I tried to check in early because I became ill on an early morning flight and was told by a very rude man at the desk that the room would be ready at 3:00. When I asked if there was any chance the room would be available early since I was ill, the man said in a very condescending voice, " I said the room will be ready at 3". Other than the rude check-in, I found the hotel to be very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The pool was nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this Candlewood for a week and we had a really good experience here. Our kids loved being able to go swimming in the heated pool(when it worked). The staff was extremely helpful when you asked for something and they were very kind. LOVED THE FREE LAUNDRY! And videos you could check-out to your room. We also liked the little convient store that they had. The whole place seemed clean and had a clean smell too.

HotelInfo.Name: Candlewood Suites Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 11411 N Black Canyon Highway, Phoenix, AZ 85029
